content: Can you provide an alternative way to express the sentence "He stumbled and fell flat on his face"? Perhaps, you can consider adding more details such as the cause of the stumble or the consequences of the fall.

Certainly! Here's an alternative way to express that sentence with more detail:

"As he navigated the uneven sidewalk, his foot caught on a protruding stone, causing him to lose his balance and topple forward, landing face-first with a thud, much to his embarrassment and the concern of onlookers."
